meanings.definition: To restrain or prevent (someone or something) from doing something
meanings.sent1: Loud noises can inhibit concentration during a test.
meanings.sent2: The locked gate will inhibit anyone from entering the restricted area.
meanings.sent3: Trying to study with a noisy parrot can inhibit your focus.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure seemed to inhibit her from taking risks.
meanings.sent5: The bright light shining directly in his eyes seemed to inhibit his ability to see clearly.

meanings.definition: To hinder or impede the progress or movement of someone or something
meanings.sent1: The heavy traffic can inhibit the delivery trucks from reaching their destination on time.
meanings.sent2: A broken bridge can inhibit travelers from crossing the river.
meanings.sent3: Wearing shoes that are too tight can inhibit your ability to walk comfortably.
meanings.sent4: The thick fog inhibited visibility on the road, causing delays.
meanings.sent5: The tangled vines inhibited the explorers' progress through the dense jungle.

meanings.definition: To suppress or limit the activity or function of someone or something
meanings.sent1: Certain medications can inhibit the growth of bacteria in the body.
meanings.sent2: The cold weather can inhibit the performance of electronic devices.
meanings.sent3: Eating too much sugar can inhibit your body's ability to regulate blood sugar levels.
meanings.sent4: The strict rules seemed to inhibit creativity in the art class.
meanings.sent5: The lack of proper equipment can inhibit the team's ability to complete the project on time.
